augGauss 0.0.0.9000

    augGauss

    augGauss.Rmd

    Goal of package

    Installation

    ‘augGauss’ is under active development, you can install the development version of ‘augGauss’ from GitHub with:

    # install.packages("remotes")
remotes::install_github("fontikar/augGauss")

library(augGauss)

    Getting started

    We will be using some example data to demonstrate the main functions of augGauss 

    demo_data |> print(n = 6)
#> # A tibble: 630 × 4
#>    subj group      x     y
#>   <dbl> <chr>  <dbl> <dbl>
#> 1     1 group1 -0.5   5.06
#> 2     1 group1 -0.45  6.74
#> 3     1 group1 -0.4  10.2 
#> 4     1 group1 -0.35 11.5 
#> 5     1 group1 -0.3  18.8 
#> 6     1 group1 -0.25 28.8 
#> # ℹ 624 more rows

?demo_data

    Simulate gradients from raw data 

    sim_data <- simulate_data(nSubj = 10, nGroups = 3)

sim_data  |> print(n = 6)
#> # A tibble: 630 × 4
#>    subj group      x      y
#>   <dbl> <chr>  <dbl>  <dbl>
#> 1     1 group1 -0.5  0     
#> 2     1 group1 -0.45 0.0988
#> 3     1 group1 -0.4  2.71  
#> 4     1 group1 -0.35 2.40  
#> 5     1 group1 -0.3  1.80  
#> 6     1 group1 -0.25 4.59  
#> # ℹ 624 more rows

    You can save the simulated data by setting the save_data argument to TRUE

    sim_data <- simulate_data(nSubj = 10, nGroups = 3, save_data = TRUE)

    Plot the simulated gradients 

    plot_simulated_data(sim_data)

    transformed_data <- sim_data |> transform_data()

combined <- aug_fit_model(transformed_data = transformed_data, iter = 100, chains = 2)

    Highest posterior densities 

    Get_HDIs(combined)

    Plot_Posterior_Preds_by_group(combined, "group3", include_preds = TRUE)
